Title: Iran-Israel war: latest developments
Summary: Israel said Tuesday it had agreed to US President Donald Trump’s proposal for a ceasefire with Iran, on the 12th day of war between the foes .

Title: El-Rufai says he’s not good at picking successful presidents, tells Nigerians to decide for themselves
Summary: Nasir El-Rufai urges Nigerians not to rely on his political endorsements ahead of the 2027 elections . Former Governor of Kaduna State, El-rufai says he's not good at picking successful presidents . The former Kaduna Governor says he has a track record of poor judgement in backing candidates .

Title: Brazil’s vice president, wife arrive Nigeria for strategic talks
Summary: Visit to unlock multi-billion-dollar trade deals as both nations deepen South-South partnership, says Presidency . Brazilian Vice President Geraldo Alckmin and his wife, Maria Lúcia, touched down this morning at the Presidential Wing of Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, marking the arrival .

Title: Man arrested for running illegal abattoir in Lagos home
Summary: Lagos State Ministry of Environment and Water Resources have arrested a man for illegally converting his residential property into an abattoir . The ministry disclosed the development on Monday in a statement by the ministry .

Title: Tiv, Fulani communities sign peace pact to end years of conflict in Taraba
Summary: Leaders of the Tiv and Fulani communities in Gassol Local Government Council have signed a peace accord to end recurring clashes between the two ethnic groups . The peace pact was a breakthrough for peacebuilding efforts in Taraba State .

Title: Qatar summons Iranian ambassador over missile attack
Summary: Qatar summons Iranian ambassador in Doha to reiterate its condemnation of Iran’s targeting of a military base in the Gulf . The Qatari Foreign Ministry said it has summoned the Iranian ambassador .

Title: Rivers crisis: Hoodlums kill policeman, vigilante in Ahoada
Summary: Two persons were reportedly killed at the gate of Ahoada-East LGA following an attack by bandits on Monday night . The two persons were reported to have been killed in the attack .

Title: Tinubu withholds assent to National Assembly Library Trust Fund amendment bill
Summary: Tinubu identified problematic areas including the funding structure for agencies under the National Assembly, taxation of national entities etc. Tinubus said . The National Assembly Library Trust Fund amendment bill will not be approved by the Senate .

Title: Desist from distorting June 12 history ,TYF tells Lamido
Summary: Think Yoruba First urges Sule Lamido to desist from distorting history of June 12 struggle . Lamido's version maligns President Tinubu and the late MKO Abiola’s family .

Title: I never got along with Tinubu, only supported due to party interest – El-Rufai
Summary: "Tinubu never really liked me, and we never got along," says El-Rufai . "We were among the first leaders of the party," he says . "I got along with Baba Akande, and as his deputy national secretary, we were among first leaders," he said .

Title: C'River poly staff demand six months' unpaid salaries
Summary: Staff of the former Institute of Technology and Management, Ugep, staged a protest in Calabar on Monday over six months of unpaid salaries . The workers said they haven’t been paid since January 2025, following the Cross River State Government’s handover of ITM to the newly established Federal Polytechnic,

Title: Jeff Bezos' wedding sparks outrage in overtourism-weary Venice
Summary: Celebrities in superyachts sail into Venice this week for the three-day wedding party of Amazon tycoon Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez . The tech magnate and journalist have reportedly invited about 200 guests to their multi-million dollar nuptials in the Italian city . Guests include Leonardo DiCaprio, Mick Jagger, Kim

Title: Iran accuses Israel of continued strikes despite ceasefire announcement
Summary: Iran’s armed forces accused Israel of launching strikes at the Islamic republic until Tuesday morning, after US President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between the two foes . “The Zionist regime launched three waves of attacks on sites in Iranian territory until 9:00 am (0530 GMT) today,” a spokesman for the armed forces

Title: CDS's comments on Benue attacks misrepresented, says DHQ
Summary: Defence Headquarters has clarified that the Chief of Defence Staff, Gen. Christopher Musa never blamed the victims of the recent Benue killings as being represented in sections of the media . This is contained in a statement by the Director of Defence Information, Brig.-Gen. Tukur Gusau, on Tuesday in Abuja . Gusau said

Title: Police begin night patrol to enhance security in Anambra
Summary: As part of efforts to enhance the security of lives and properties, the Anambra State Police Command has commenced night patrols . The Commissioner of Police, Ikioye Orutugu, stepped up the night patrols aimed at reinforcing the police’s commitment to serving and protecting the community .
